author: Staff Reporter
text:
‘Vibrance ’16’, a two-day cultural and sports festival began at the Chennai campus of VIT University on Friday. While inaugurating the festival and handing over prizes for the intra-cultural and sports events conducted earlier, international para-athlete, Malathi Krishnamurthi Holla, appealed to students to devote at least 30 minutes for physical fitness.

Assistant vice president, VIT University, Kadhambari S. Viswanathan said more than 40 colleges and universities had sent their registrations for the 77 events planned over two days. Noel Sean and Mounima, who shot to fame with their songs in ‘Bahubali’ took part in the inaugural session, performing together on request from students.

‘Adaptune’, ‘bollywood battle’, ‘dancing duo’ and ‘choreo-night’ were some of the popular events on the first day. The college’s literary association conducted competitions in Telugu, Tamil and English.
title: ‘Devote time for physical fitness’
